page.title: 13CLUBS AND EVENTS
page.content: Most of the clubs and events in the area take place in the village of West Pennard and make use of the Village Hall and school facilities. Clubs include a youth club and a Brownie pack. There is an active Women's Institute, a Parent Teacher Association and the Parochial Church Council. There is a Play Group for pre -school children. The cricket club has its own grounds and pavillion to the south of the village. A recent innovation is the cycling club which visits local places of interest. There are choir practices and bell ringing. Annual events include the church fete, a horse show and a harvest supper. The Blackmore and Sparkford Vale fox hounds meet about twice a year in our area and the Chilmark beagles rather more often.
